summary:
Insanely overpowered Mage Follower. Marriageable, immortal, pretty.

Warrior build available as optional file.
descriptionHtml:
[b]NOTE: REGARDING SKYRIM SPECIAL EDITION

[/b]Hroki has been ported over to Skyrim Special Edition, preliminary testing without any other mods has shown encouraging results, Hroki has intact functionality as far as I can tell.


This is my first ever mod, it has been a part of my playthroughs for many years but I never quite plucked up the courage to release it. It turns Hroki of Markarth into an implausibly potent destruction mage, with a unique cloak spell and dragon shouts at her disposal. In addition to being powerful, she is also marriageable and immortal.

Comments, critiques and bug reports welcome, I scoured this with TESVEdit, so hopefully by the grace of Goku, your computer won't scream in agony when running this.

Concise Follower Stats:

Name: Hroki the Valiant
Level: 50 onwards
Combat style: Destruction Mage with Dragon shouts
Location: Silver-Blood inn, Markarth (Note: her AI Packages are unchanged, she will wander around)
BodyType: Whatever you have installed, if anything.

Health: approx. 1500
Magicka: approx 1200
Stamina: approx 200
Requires Dawnguard.esm, Dragonborn.esm, Update.esm and Skyrim (version 1.9-something-or-other, the latest and last)

Developer notes: I have tested experimental character builds for Hroki, most notably, summon spells. Results are not encouraging; Hroki will never use them, regardless of skill level or perks added. So I scrapped the summons idea and reverted her back to pure destruction.
Â 
Additionally, I noticed in earlier builds Hroki would spam Lightning spells to the exclusion of all other types. This annoyed me, so I got rid of them. Now Hroki alternates between frost and fire as I originally wanted.

UPDATE: Have released optional module, turning Hroki into a warrior tank build. New save recommended, or at least one where you haven't met her yet; changes to npcs mid game don't always carry over, as details get baked into save. Of course you could try the old "disable, recycleactor, enable" console commands, but I don't know how well they work. Do not use main file and optional together.
